thread.title: Alabama Gameday: Complete Guide to Crimson Tide's home game against Tennessee Volunteers
thread.title_full: Alabama Gameday: Complete Guide to Crimson Tide's home game against Tennessee Volunteers

author: Ben Flanagan | bflanagan@al.com
title: Alabama Gameday: Complete Guide to Crimson Tide's home game against Tennessee Volunteers
text:
Below are links and information to help your game day experience this weekend in Tuscaloosa. Included is information on weather, parking and much more. 
BRYANT-DENNY STADIUM GATES OPEN: 12:30 p.m. (Student gates open at noon) 
WALK OF CHAMPIONS: 12:30 p.m. 
ELEPHANT STOMP: 1:30 p.m. at Gorgas Library 
KICKOFF: 2:30 p.m. 
TV: CBS 
TWITTER: Stay up to date before, during and after the game by following AL.com's Michael Casagrande , John Talty , Matt Zenitz , Drew Champlin and Matt Scalici , or aldotcomTide . You can also follow UAGameday on Twitter for constant updates about this weekend's festivities. Read our full list of the must-follows for Alabama fans this season. 
WEATHER Saturday's forecast calls for sunny skies with a high near 82, followed by mostly cloudy skies with an overnight low around 63. So that sounds like good football weather and no rain, for the time being. If you come a day early, Friday should see mostly sunny skies with a high near 83, followed by mostly cloudy skies and an overnight low around 63. If you stay an extra day, expect sunny skies with a high near 79 and a 20 percent chance of rain after 8 a.m. on Sunday, followed by mostly cloudy skies with an overnight low around 65. 
PARKING/TRAFFIC Visit the UA Gameday Operations website for extensive tips on traveling to and from Tuscaloosa on Saturdays. You'll find pregame and postgame traffic maps that should help you find our way in and around campus and town. 
Two road construction projects in and around Tuscaloosa will affect those traveling, especially anyone coming from Birmingham. Learn more about the lane-widening on I-59 and bridge reconstruction in Alberta City that travelers will run into this weekend and the rest of the season. 
From UA Gameday: "Combine regular Gameday traffic with the roadwork on I-20/59 around exit 79 and we could be looking at severe backups on the traffic coming into town. Please leave early to allow extra time for possible backups and the reduced speed limits in the construction areas. Please check the two alternatives to bypass the backups: 
Utilizing Exit 89, which is the Mercedes Plant exit. This will give you easy access to Highway 11 westbound. Highway 11 will bring you straight into campus. Utilizing Exit 100, to easily access Highway 216 westbound. Highway 216 turns into 15th Street (Veteran's Memorial Parkway) once you arrive in Tuscaloosa. WILL CALL The Will Call window will open at 10:30 a.m. and is located between Gates 32 and 33 at Bryant-Denny Stadium.
